ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An introductory class to the Himalayan anthropology and linguistics.Highly recommended.

It's an inter-disciplinary discussion class, which needs to be more of a thing. You don't need to be a linguist or an anthropologist, but you have to be able to read different kinds of literature and it helps to be the kind of person who is interested in everything.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Even though I had some previous background knowledge about the material covered in the class, it helped me connect the dots see the big picture. Also, considering my future studies, it was extremely informative to see the current state of Himalayan studies: what is being done in the field.
Hopefully it will have given me an inroad into my study area for my dissertation research by connecting me with some scholars.
